comments: The compositions of n in which each natural number is colored by one of p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n. For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of 20-colored compositions of n such that no adjacent parts have the same color. - Milan Janjic, Nov 17 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (20).
formula: G.f.: 1/(1-20x), e.g.f.: exp(20x)a(n)=20^n; a(n)=20*a(n-1) n>0 a(0)=1. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 21 2010
prog: (Sage) [lucas_number1(n,20,0) for n in xrange(1, 17)]# - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 29 2009(MAGMA)[20^n: n in [0..100]] [From Vincenzo Librandi, Nov 21 2010](Maxima) A009964(n):=20^n$makelist(A009964(n),n,0,30); /* _Martin Ettl_, Nov 05 2012 */(PARI) a(n)=20^n \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 19 2015(PARI) powers(20,12) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 19 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
